summary: The diff demonstrates comprehensive implementation of both requirements. REQ-1 is addressed through client-side validation, actor readiness checks, structured data formatting, and proper error handling with user feedback. REQ-2 is extensively implemented with detailed console logging throughout the submission flow, error categorization, and inline validation messages. All acceptance criteria appear to be met based on the code changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Added extensive error categorization system with labels like 'ACTOR_INITIALIZATION', 'ACTOR_LOADING', 'NETWORK_ERROR'
hallucinated_features.reason: While REQ-2 requested error logging and validation feedback, the specific categorization system (with category labels) goes beyond what was explicitly requested

hallucinated_features.description: Added toast notifications using 'sonner' library for user feedback
hallucinated_features.reason: Toast notifications were not mentioned in the requirements or acceptance criteria, though they serve the general goal of user feedback

hallucinated_features.description: Added runtime regression checks for id=0 submissions in DashboardPage
hallucinated_features.reason: This debugging feature was not requested in either requirement
